title.text: On the Evaluation and Comparison of Taggers: the Effect of Noise in Testing Corpora

abstractContent.text: This paper addresses the issue of POS tagger evaluation.
Such evaluation is usually performed by comparing the tagger output with a reference test corpus, which is assumed to be error-free.
Currently used corpora contain noise which causes the obtained performance to be a distortion of the real value.
We analyze to what extent this distortion may invalidate the comparison between taggers or the measure of the improvement given by anew system.
The main conclusion is that a more rigorous testing experimentation setting/designing is needed to reliably evaluate and compare tagger accuracies.
